meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being studious or intellectual, especially in a way that is perceived as excessive or pretentious.
meanings.sent1: Her bookishnesses were evident in the way she always carried a stack of novels with her.
meanings.sent2: His bookishnesses shone through when he quoted Shakespeare during casual conversations.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bookishnesses, he still enjoyed playing soccer with his friends on weekends.
meanings.sent4: The bookishnesses of the library seemed to envelop her in a cocoon of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The bookishnesses of the professor were so intense that even the walls of the classroom seemed to whisper secrets of ancient texts.

meanings.definition: The state of being overly concerned with academic pursuits or literary activities.
meanings.sent1: The bookishnesses of the students were evident as they spent hours in the library every day.
meanings.sent2: Her bookishnesses led her to win the school's literature competition for the third year in a row.
meanings.sent3: The bookishnesses of the book club members sometimes led to heated debates over classic novels.
meanings.sent4: His bookishnesses were like a shield against the distractions of the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The bookishnesses of the author were reflected in the intricate plots of her mystery novels.
